website_summaries.verdict: Don't let the low price fool you; this Casio calculator is capable of handling most equations without breaking your budget.
pros: A basic graphing calculator with a nice build and all the necessary capabilities to solve a variety of equations
cons: Not pro-grade, but most students will find it's all they need

customer_reviews.title: Much cheaper than those rip-off TI calculators and more capable ...
customer_reviews.text: Much cheaper than those rip-off TI calculators and more capable. Also, I see some reviews complaining this calculator does not do natural display. It does if you flash custom firmware on it. Just google "fx-9750gii natural display" and you will find numerous tutorials and videos on how to do it. I've already done it to mine.
customer_reviews.author: nighteye19

customer_reviews.title: Impossible packaging
customer_reviews.text: Calculator works fine, but it took about 3 of us about 45 min to get it out of the packaging. It would receive a higher rating that that if it didn't take such will power and tools to cut from package.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Jorgensen

customer_reviews.title: Bulletproof packaging
customer_reviews.text: This would have 5 stars if it weren’t for the packaging. I’m pretty sure the plastic it comes in is actually bulletproof. It took two people and almost an hour with two pairs of scissors, a box cutter, and pocket knife to open it just enough to let the damn calculator BARELY come out. Other than that, I’m glad I didn’t pay over $100 for the “name brand” version.
customer_reviews.author: sophia waters

customer_reviews.title: it'd be cool if i were able to open this insanely ridicolous packaging.
customer_reviews.text: I really can NOT believe how ridiculous this packaging is. Am I missing something or is this a prank? I am beyond PISSED at the fact that I was so eager to use this, but I can NOT even freaking OPEN ITTTTTTT. DOES NOT EVEN DESERVE ONE STAR. PERO WHYYYYY? Scissors, knives nothing is working and I am beyond LIVID.
customer_reviews.author: Mahlet

customer_reviews.title: Here’s some 411 on that crazy packaging! 😃
customer_reviews.text: For anyone struggling with the package, I found a somewhat easy solution to open it. Flip the package over. Use a flat head screwdriver and wedge it between the plastic backing and the front (you’ll see what I mean when you’re holding it) at the points of the melted purple rivets. Like a lever, push down on the handle of the screwdriver as the flat head lifts up and separates the 2 thick plastic pieces. Repeat with all the rivets until the 2 plastic pieces are no longer attached and remove the calculator, batteries and instructions.
customer_reviews.author: K. Delaney

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY! Worst scientific calculator!
customer_reviews.text: There is no fraction results(it only gives decimal results), which is a real pain in the *** if you need it for anything higher than middle school math. Input format is weird, not same as other Casio calculators, neither as TIs. Returned after one day of use.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson Z.

customer_reviews.title: May be great inside if you have 45 minutes to get it open.
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculous packaging!!!! In a hard clamshell case with plastic rivets- impossible to open, had to get out cutting shears and power tools. C'mon Amazon!!!!
customer_reviews.author: em b.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: COMES IN SEALED UNBREAKABLE PLASTIC CASE THAT CANNOT BE OPENED. INSANE, MAKES NO SENSE WHY THEY WOULD DO THIS. the back says "made in Taiwan", I guess this is the nonsense you get when you outsource the manufacturing of something as simple as a graphing calculator!
customer_reviews.author: N E O N _ H E A R T S

customer_reviews.title: Packaging is a demon spawn
customer_reviews.text: I've spent 4 hours trying to open this packaging. I've tried scissors. I tried remelting the rivets to pry them off. And I've tried a hammer. God has left this packaging and it will never open. Save yourself.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Nicoloff

customer_reviews.title: Aviator snips, are recommended, to open the package.
customer_reviews.text: My son says, that it does what it should be doing, That being said, it took, me, & my son (20 yrs old ), about 30 minutes, to open. However, on the back of the pkg, it warned not to injure yourself, opening it, nice touch. The pkg resisted knives, (3, 2" blade -8" blade ) a box cutter with a fresh blade, a single edge razor blade, 2 pairs of plyers, a wood chisel, a pair of scissors, intended for frozen vegetables, and ultimately a pair of aviation style tin snips. recommend starting with the aviation snips.
customer_reviews.author: DJ'sDad

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Casio graphing calculators are not as durable as Texas Instruments but they cost a lot less, which is why my school use then. I like them a lot because they are menu driven so you don't have to remember any syntax. This model does not do symbolic algebra but will do just about anything else. The price was about the same, or a little lower, than you'll find anywhere for this model. Not much of a learning curve to use these.
customer_reviews.author: B. LEARY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for ACT and SAT!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our son's Algebra II class. It was wonderful. The batteries lasted forever even though we packed extra for his ACT exams. The menu is easy to navigate, once you take time to learn it. It also works as a financial calculator that I was able to use for accounting. This is by far the best for the price and the screen even offers a zoom in/out feature for graphing. You can zoom out to see the overall look of the graph. It also calculates slope intercept and more. It takes time to learn to use, but has lasted my son through his college math classes.
customer_reviews.author: Hopkins Academy

customer_reviews.title: Using nail clippers, can easily remove the hard shell
customer_reviews.text: If it is a color screen, it will be perfect! However, that will not be the current price. Let me emphasize how I took out the calculator, hoping to give other buyers a reference. Yes! Don't doubt your eyes! With only nail clippers, the packaging shell that many people complained about was removed. I cut off one side of the plastic rivet with nail clippers and then removed the rivet from the other side. After taking out all six rivets, the case separates naturally and the calculator can be easily taken out. When I take out the manual, the tape on both sides will take the battery out of the box together.
customer_reviews.author: Doris8069

customer_reviews.title: Make TI owners jealous at 1/2 the price (Engineering Major)
customer_reviews.text: The main reasons I worship this calculator are for 1. It is so easy to solve for an unknown in an equation. 2. 3 equations, 3 unknowns? no problem 3. So much more user friendly than the TI 80s i have owned in the past. My friends with TI's wish they could solve 3 eqs and 3 unknowns as easily is I can What I don't like Having to use a different calculator when a prof says you can't use programmable calculators on the test
customer_reviews.author: Stusat

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to the more expensive competitors
customer_reviews.text: I got this calculator for some of my classes when I went back to school. The TI-83 and 85 were on the recommended list, and I just didn't want to spend that kind of money because I am not the kind of person who plans to get any use out of this once school is done with. So far, I love it. It does exactly what I need it to do, and I've been able to figure out how to use most of the features on my own. It was a bit difficult for me to figure out at first because the menus are slightly different than the competitor's, but it's worked great so far. No real complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Packaging is ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is good. But it’s the worst experience of opening anything ever!! The packaging is ridiculous! There’s no explanation at all. Cost me an hour to figure it out. Almost wanted to give no star. Two stars are for the product itself. So be aware of the packaging issue! Ps: except the packaging part it’s five star
customer_reviews.author: Zhouxing Hu

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great cheap replacement for the TI calculators. It has all the same features and in some ways it’s better, like having a menu of all the tools rather than having to memorize where everything is. The downside of using this calculator is that in class we learn new things everyday and while the professor goes step by step with the rest of the class I have to figure out things using google and it’s not the easiest things. So the problem is that if you don’t know how to do something you have to figure it out by yourself while everyone else’s is fine with theirs TIs.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Once You Understand It, It's Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I had to get a graphing calculator at protest... For my math classes! However, this past semester [about a year after buying], I see the value in having this calculator to do my work for me, rather than sitting there trying to figure out what Pearson is talking about! College students will know exactly what I mean. It's worth buying, a lot cheaper than T.I. and does the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: My son had to have this for High school I bought it because it had good reviews and was cheaper than most. It works great only downfall was his teacher recommend Texas instrument she was familiar with that one and could show them how to use it. She had never used the casio so my son had to figure it out on his own but he stated it was fairly easy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works amazing, save your money and buy a Casio
customer_reviews.text: Used for college calculus, works amazing, save your money and buy a Casio. For calculus, graphing and tricks are wayyyy easier on this versus TI. Very simple to use. Ditch the manual and watch YouTube instructions to get familiar with it. Cute color!
customer_reviews.author: Cait

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for beginners and experts
customer_reviews.text: Very cool. I never took the time to use it to its full potential because I’m lazy.... BUT it’s easy to pick up on the useful basics you may need more immediately. It’s very deluxe. I bought pink because it made me giggle, but it’s a fun color. I’m sure a lot of you math guys and gals will make excellent and full use of this calculator!
customer_reviews.author: WW

customer_reviews.title: This is more complicated than most computers made before 1995 ...
customer_reviews.text: This is more complicated than most computers made before 1995. It has way more functionality than I will ever use unless I choose to become a nuclear physicist or bridge design engineer. What I did need it for was the graphing function. My university does not allow me to take tests with calculators that have a Computer Algebra System (CAS), and this is the only currently available *inexpensive* graphing calculator I could find without a CAS. Others I find are almost twice the price and more. For this it worked magnificently. I passed the graphing part of my algebra final with flying colors.
customer_reviews.author: dosboss

customer_reviews.title: Great multipurpose calculator
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an a graduate level stats/finance course and really came in handy. It's not complicated and reminds of the old T series from my high school days. You can't beat the price. As others have noted, it is hard to open but you have to follow the directions on the back of the package. The website also has a helpful video . Many of the people that were struggling to open are either to lazy to look at the video or lack basic reading comprehension skills.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Item as described for the most part
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived promptly and in good condition. The packaging is difficult to open. Mine did not come with the USB connectivity for file sharing as in description. That's the reason for missing star rating. Youtube videos assist in computing tasks and learning how to use the device. This calculator gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Just my 2 cents

customer_reviews.title: Why buy TI calculators when you can buy this?
customer_reviews.text: This is more pleasant to use than TI calculators at a fraction of the price. The only con, in my opinion, is that it's a bit hard to figure out how to use certain functions that have multiple arguments because the order of the arguments doesn't seem to be documented anywhere. Maybe I'm mistaken. Probably my favorite thing about this calculator is that if you have gone into a sub-menu to access a certain function (for example, cumulative normal probability distribution function), it will stay there after you enter the calculation, so you can access it repeatedly. Everything about this calculator seems designed to be user-friendly. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rowan Belt

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Packaging
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea about the calculator itself yet but the packaging is horrible!! I sent it to my daughter in college and the plastic was so thick that she couldn't even cut through it. It was even riveted shut with plastic rivets and she actually cut herself trying to get it open.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Casio: good quality, good price
customer_reviews.text: This was less expensive than other brands, but I've always found Casio products to be high quality. I bought this for my son in college. For engineering, he may need a different kind later, but this was a great one for a start. He's very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: vicsgirl

customer_reviews.title: It generally makes me satisfied and I believe it's worth buying
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator for my ap calculus exam, and I believe its features are going to help me well. I chose this product because its price is almost half of the other calculators', and it has almost the same features. One issue was that it was hard to learn how to use it, which took me a while. Another issue is that when you graph a complex function, it's gonna take a long time (like a minute) to show the graph and calculation. But still, those shouldn't be big problems, as long as you learn and get used to it. It is absolutely worth buying, five star
customer_reviews.author: Frank Chen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent calculator! Helped my son get a 5 on ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent calculator! Helped my son get a 5 on the Calculus AB AP! Worked continuously for several years and probably would have been fine for many more but we'll never know as he recently lost it! We loved it so much however that we just replaced it with the same model. Thank you, Casio. Hopefully, he'll do just as well on the Calculus BC AP this year.
customer_reviews.author: Wendi Woo

customer_reviews.title: Cannot open package
customer_reviews.text: The package is extremely hard and thick plastic that makes the product unusable because I cannot get it open.
customer_reviews.author: J. M.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed In A Calculator At A Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is perfect for what I needed. I recently went to a Fuels class for the military and had to go through a Hydraulics section and this calculator helped so much. I was able to use multiple lines so I could see the formulas broken down and in full rather than only pieces at a time. I was so happy to purchase this one over the T3I which is almost twice the price. I don't see any reason to go with any calculator other than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie L

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are affordable and do everything the more expensive ones do. Our problem is that our kids teacher recommended the more expensive ones and couldn't help our kids figure out how to do the calculations on these. I wish the teacher would have picked the more affordable option. We eventually figured everything out. I've put 3 through AP Stats with this calculator.
customer_reviews.author: D. Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Confusing but great
customer_reviews.text: Needed a graphing calculator for 2 of my current classes .. this is great once you figure out how to use it .. all the buttons and shift functions are confusing and create hassle and errors but once you get passed the headache it's very handy
customer_reviews.author: Krissy Noel

customer_reviews.title: Very Responsible Seller, I just received a faulty product.
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great value maybe if I could even have turned it off. It gets great tech reviews in general although it does say there is a high learning curve which offsets much lower price point for similar functionality to ti-83 @ 3/4 the price. It came to me new in package but would not turn off. I followed instructions which are complicated and crucial. In the end, I had to remove batteries to turn it off. I gave three stars to the experience overall bc it shipped quickly and the seller refunded it quickly. I probably just received a bad product. So calculator was a dud but the seller was responsible.
customer_reviews.author: catherine elliott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Calculator at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I've been a big Casio fan for several decades. I like the friendliness and simplicity of their products. I've had HP and TI scientific calculators but could never get used to them. I really hated them and always went back to Casio. This calculator is a powerful computational piece at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Engner

customer_reviews.title: Good Calc for the money
customer_reviews.text: Even though I gave this 4 stars I am actually happy with this calc. The only MAJOR problem I have found is that windows 8.1 (x64) And (x32) will NOT recognize it and makes it useless to back up any programs to the PC. However, with that said. The functions of the calculator work as they should. draws nice graphs and plots. there is the fact that the way you input the formulae is backwards from other graphing calcs I have use. I haven't tried programing from scratch yet the instructions are confusing if you have never use a graphing calc before. But all-in-all good graphing calc for the money
customer_reviews.author: Marc Lemons

customer_reviews.title: packaging is ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but I have a hard time figuring it out. It doesn't perform all the statistics functions that the TI-83/84 will do that I need it to do, that or I just can't figure it out and can't find youtube videos to help me. The packaging is ridiculous. My husband had to use metal cutters to get it open. But it's great value for a graphing calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Kia L.

customer_reviews.title: the packaging
customer_reviews.text: it's a really good calculator, and much easier to understand than TI's for me. However, it took me almost two hours with special tools to be able to get it open. it requires a special tool that can be found in many homes and unfortunately i didn't have it. if you don't you might just never get it open.
customer_reviews.author: somkele.onuoha

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's physics class. We looked a number of other graphing calculator's and decided to buy this one because the price was right and the reviews were positive. This is the second Casio graphing calculator we have purchased from him. We bought the other one else wear. It had a little less of the features of this one and we needed an upgrade. It says a lot the Casio has been around for so long.
customer_reviews.author: Jeneen Clark

customer_reviews.title: Not an engineering student, so I don't need a super fancy one
customer_reviews.text: Best calculator I've had. Not an engineering student, so I don't need a super fancy one. I just like to use it as a basic calculator, although it has many many functions available. Recommend for anyone who would like a calculator just a little bit more sophisticated than a scientific calculator. Plus I've used it on every test since freshman year of college when graphing calculators aren't allowed because it resembles a scientific calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Austin G.

customer_reviews.title: It works and the price was good as it was specified as required for my daughters ...
customer_reviews.text: It works and the price was good as it was specified as required for my daughters senior years in High School. Be interesting to see if they ever actually make use of the advanced features as they haven't yet. Seems expensive for something that by todays standards isn't exactly "powerful" - A cheap $40 "smart phone" has more processing power and a full colour screen.
customer_reviews.author: MobiusNZ

customer_reviews.title: What it is useful for.
customer_reviews.text: This is an okay calculator but its not for advanced math. It can't take long problems properly and if you don't double check you can input the wrong number. Also extractions are a bit difficult to understand but to be fair the calculator has multiple steps to do a difficult equation. Recommend paying a little more on a more expensive calculator if you're doing collage level math. if you are looking for something for the highschool level like algebra and geometry then this would work just find although for that level off math, although your better off using an online calculator if you are using it for the highschool level of math.
customer_reviews.author: Im an allusion

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Still working through how to do everything
customer_reviews.text: Packed full of features, and fairly intuitive. Great price. Still working through how to do everything, but it seems to do everything I am looking to do in algebra and physics. Downloaded free user manual to my smartphone, so am able to find how-to answers pretty quick.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa E. Archbold

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great price
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is a great price, however after 3 weeks of use it would no longer turn on. Customer service made sure to get us a new calculator right out. Return was super easy, we did not have the package anymore and we were able to return it at kohl’s and they packed it back up to send back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mrsmoba

customer_reviews.title: Not manual included on the package.
customer_reviews.text: The manual is not included on the package and you need to go on-line to either download it or watch YouTube videos, this is the only downside, otherwise the product is really good, with tons of functions to complete your maths assignments.
customer_reviews.author: RoCa

customer_reviews.title: Great affords alternative!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter used this for her 9th grade school work. Cheaper then the competition and works just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Christina B.

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome calculator!!
customer_reviews.text: This graphing calculator was awesome, it's just what my children needed to complete their homework. The price was very reasonable, it came with a hard cover, arrived in 2 days as promised, and was very easy to use. I would like to thank Casio for making such an awesome calculator and Amazon for making it so affordable. I don't have a lot of money and have been relying on Amazon to get things we need at a fair price. Thank you Amazon for doing what you do! I am a truly satisfied customer!!!
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Cannot use for high school
customer_reviews.text: Cannot use for high school, the teacher uses the more expensive TI version and will not work with child who can't afford one. Had to borrow an old one from someone as school will not allow students to use school provided (paid for my taxes) TI calculator. Im just a little bitter. Calculator works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: a.riddles

customer_reviews.title: Best product for its price.
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is very good for doing large matrix operations. You can program your formulas and expressions to get the result faster. The memory is good and big display makes it easy for the user. I would recommend this calculator to engineering students and professional.
customer_reviews.author: Anish Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Great price, awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing calculator. I do not understand why people think it is difficult to use. I did not need to read the book, just played on it for a few minutes and got use to the functions. This is definitely a great buy. I would buy it sooner rather than later, because with school about to begin again, this will probably be on back-order. I was nervous after reading reviews about it being difficult, but definitely not. I am a lady in my 30's, who is not a whiz on the computer and needed a graphing calculator for school, and have not had a problem with this. If you buy the TI, you just wasted an extra $50.
customer_reviews.author: This_Mom_Loves_All_Things_Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a calculator that does what you need it to. Using this for my stats class and it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Good gift
customer_reviews.text: Just what my grandson asked for. I didn't like the packaging... It was stamped all over saying "school property", but I guess It is an appropriate calculator for his needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners and students.
customer_reviews.text: I create surveying programs in CASIO basic and this 9750 makes testing code very easy!
customer_reviews.author: Jack M. Kesler

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The graph calculator is, in itself, an amazing array of 'Whoa, what?'. Look up tutorials to figure it out and you will be fine. This calculator is a great value for its money. Especially that the other competitors are ridiculously expensive.
customer_reviews.author: dmoser13

customer_reviews.title: Adequate- once you can remove it from the packaging!
customer_reviews.text: Performs as expected. My classmates have graphing calculators that are simpler to use than this one. More challenging than learning to use it was getting it out of the special packaging! 3 different people we’re trying to break it out of hard plastic with rivets. Took us over two minutes just to free it from the excessive protective case!
customer_reviews.author: M. Grigg

customer_reviews.title: This is the best calculator among graphic calculators. If you can use your smartphone instead.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the graphic calculators are nonsense. It is better to buy a smartphone that will do all the functions calculator will and you will save money. That said, colleges and schools may not allow a smartphone and will require to purchase a graphic calculator. In that case your best bet would be to purchase Casio. Very intuitive design, graphs looks 10x better than other brands' calculators. In my calculus class everyone is jealous that I spent half the price and got 10x better calculator. I believe that in comparison with other calculators it deserves 5 stars. DO NOT BUY A GRAPHIC CALCULATOR UNLESS SPECIFICALLY REQUIRED BY A SCHOOL!
customer_reviews.author: Irek

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm doing Calculus I now and this thing works! The instructor demonstrates with TI 84 so I've got to figure this calculator out by trial and error, using the manual (download the online one) or YouTube. It took a lot of effort taking it out of its packaging but it's otherwise worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smart purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Don't waste the extra money on the ti82, this will fulfill all your needs for half the price
customer_reviews.author: Nia Ball

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Statistics
customer_reviews.text: A great calculator and very useful calculator. For its price, it can compete with some of the more expensive calculators. I would highly recommend this for any college student who does not want to spend a whole lot of money on a calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Mireles

customer_reviews.title: Better than expensive calculator
customer_reviews.text: Way cheaper than TI graphing calculators and does the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mandatory for all my HS Math Classes
customer_reviews.text: Casio 9750 is the best calculator. I’ve required it in all my math classes from Algebra to AP Calculus for 10 years. It’s easy, YouTube has a great tutorial if teacher is not familiar with them. Also it’s less steps and a time saver for standardized test. It is a pleasure to have the Casio 9750 in my classroom.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty good and helps for High School teens.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Fragoso

customer_reviews.title: Friend loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Im writing on behalf of the friend I purchased this for. She told me that the class was using TI models. She said that it didn't take long for her to learn this system and when she was up and running the applications were much easier to use. She claimed her classmates were constantly stuck and asking questions and she had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: DLM

customer_reviews.title: gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my granddaughter. No complaints from her. She was just so grateful.
customer_reviews.author: L. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a high school student in need. My son has one and it helped him. Since it's for a student in need. Thought this would be useful
customer_reviews.author: Cary

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Coming from using a TI-84 for years and years it’s rather difficult to switch to this one. It has everything I need. Is a great value for what it does I just can’t get over the difference in devices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible packaging and weird scratches/powder
customer_reviews.text: The packaging is impossible to open. And my calculator came with scratches, and other imperfections, also a weird powdery substance when I opened the case? I know it’s just a calculator and it doesn’t have to be beautiful lol but I didn’t pay 40 dollars for scratches, imperfections, and weird powder. Not sure how the scratches even got there considering how “bullet proof” the packaging was. Overall not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar

customer_reviews.title: Great for our use
customer_reviews.text: Great calculator for my sons homework.. it is hard to get out of the package just slip a pair of scissors in between the blackish plastic rivets and it comes right open when you pop those apart.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Great graphing calculator
customer_reviews.text: Just as a heads up everyone has the Texas Instrument calculator and that's the one instructors will teach. That being said, the differences are not significant enough that you won't be able to figure it out. And I really like this calculator. I've used it through a whole semester of precalculus and the only trouble I've had is going directly to a specific point on a graph, but I think I just haven't figured that out yet. Overall this is a good graphing calculator for half the price. If you're on a budget, get it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert McCl

customer_reviews.title: Save money
customer_reviews.text: Good calculator. It wasn’t exactly the right calculator for college statistics, but with some online research we were able to make it work. And it saved us a ton of money, so I’d say that it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Jefferies

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator, no issues keeping up with TI!
customer_reviews.text: Needed this calculator for my exploration math class and statistics. Our professor luckily isn't picky about which calculator to use but she does use a TI. I bought this and I haven't had any problems with keeping up with our professor. The keys are labeled similar to the TI and the calculator is half the price. I would highly recommend if your able to use a different brand from the TI that I've found most professors prefer. I chose the pink and it's exactly as the picture shows. 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Sara Egan

customer_reviews.title: First impression
customer_reviews.text: I rated it in the middle because I never actually used it. I later found out that I wouldn’t need such an advanced calculator so I returned it. When I first got it though and was playing around with it, it was very difficult to learn. Not sure I would’ve liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Ozioma Nwokike

customer_reviews.title: Nice cover
customer_reviews.text: Like that it comes with a slide on hard cover.
customer_reviews.author: meinnj

customer_reviews.title: Casio products are phenomenal!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This item delivers. It works great. You are required to purchase this items. I have no problems with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin A. Holder

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My son needed this calculator for high school. He said it’s easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Diahann Smith

customer_reviews.title: Better Than T.I.,But Could be Easier to Use
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as intuitive as the fx-115 series, but I think w/ practice it will outperform the TI-8X series. I have both and this one has the far better display. Retrospectively I would probably spend the extra for the color display if you're going to need this for more than two semesters of higher-order math.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Math who?
customer_reviews.text: Works good, except professors usually want that TI crap. Honestly who the cares? Not me that's for sure this is much cheaper anyway. BTW I hate math so don't take my word for it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works Well - just takes a bit of getting used to
customer_reviews.text: Having to switch modes to use the different capabilities was a bit confusing in the beginning - especially when compared to a TI-calculator. But once I got the hang of it, it was pretty easy to use. At half the price of a TI - definitely recommend this calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Tina W.

customer_reviews.title: Programming and matrix calculation
customer_reviews.text: Good calculator for this price. User friendly and easy to use. Good for programming and matrix calculation. Big screen enables viewing previous calculation pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Pawan

customer_reviews.title: Brand-new and Batteries won't charge!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as one of my niece's graduation presents for starting college in the fall, and she started classes last week and the brand new calculator won't hold a charge. Unfortunately, it's 3 months after buying it I can't return or exchange it.
customer_reviews.author: Fallon R Hand

customer_reviews.title: Practice with this a lot, look for help from the internet
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this a few years ago and it is still working. It is not as popular as TI calculators so you need to watch YouTube videos to figure out how to do a lot of things, but if you practice with it you can get through college level stats. In all honesty I think that if I had gotten a TI I would have had a better time in class because I would have spent more time on homework and not learning the calculator and the TIs seemed to do our homework for us, even the non-programmable calculators :(.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is great my daughter uses it all the time!the price was perfect just incase she lost it!keeps a charge needed for algrebra it is awesome for that!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paulahughes

customer_reviews.title: No worth it in a TI specific course!
customer_reviews.text: If the course calls for a specific brand then do not get this. It definitely doesn't run on the same algorithms!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator, horrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is such a good value while being just as good as the TI-83, plus it comes in pink which I love. But I had such a difficult time getting the calculator out of the packaging!!! I cut myself horribly trying to get into it with scissors and had actually slam it on the ground to break it open because I had no other way to get into. So be warned about that when purchasing this calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella Martini

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend watching Youtube videos of the functions because of it ...
customer_reviews.text: Works just as well as the TI-84, I would recommend watching Youtube videos of the functions because of it different from the TI-84. In my opinion, it is easier to use than the TI-84.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela Rivera

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: This calculator works great for my daughter's upper level math classes/
customer_reviews.author: Kerense Harryman

customer_reviews.title: for the price and performance it is a great the only draw back is the manual is difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: for the price and performance it is a great the only draw back is the manual is difficult to understand on statistics and program functions, i actually went to a local computer retail store and got help with it. After that everything has been smooth sailing.
customer_reviews.author: Gorilla711

customer_reviews.title: Good graphing calculator, fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for high school algebra, dues everything she needs at a fraction of the cost of the standard recommended graphing calculator
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great graphing calculator
customer_reviews.text: This Casio is a great graphing calculator set at an affordable price tag. Comparing it to the overpriced TI-83/84 models, get Casio any day unless you have money to blow. There is one problem though, and the calculator itself isn't even to blame, the packaging is. For 40 bucks the bulletproof titanium packaging is pretty overkill; I should get paid 40 bucks for my time and effort spent on trying to open this Fort Knox of a packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Nga Ha

customer_reviews.title: This is a great calculator. If you are in the market for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great calculator. If you are in the market for the TI-84 plus or similar i recommend you just get this one. It is a 1/3 the price, faster and easier to use. The only down side is everything at my school is writen around the TI so you are on your own on figuring out how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: jeshua

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Much cheaper than the Texas Instrument and does the same thing!
customer_reviews.author: bjcreviews

customer_reviews.title: Scientific Calculator
customer_reviews.text: It is a useful tool for my granddaughters high school classes. A real value others exactly selling for double the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great as an alternative to the ridiculously priced Texas Instrument ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great as an alternative to the ridiculously priced Texas Instrument calculators. Do not expect them to function the same or for your professors to know how to get it to work. You will need to put in more effort to figure out how to get it to do what you want it to.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W. Bush

customer_reviews.title: Best value
customer_reviews.text: Learning how to use the calculator takes awhile but great value this is a great graphing calculator
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan C.

customer_reviews.title: Need instructions on use at least short version
customer_reviews.text: Good price but difficult as can be to use. Came with no instructions and the online instructions were 43 pages. No thank you
customer_reviews.author: niki britt

customer_reviews.title: Right choice
customer_reviews.text: Bought for grandson for college. He says he likes it and it does all the functions he needs.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Martin

customer_reviews.title: Can't be the price
customer_reviews.text: This calculator costs half as much as any Texas Instruments graphing calculator and it's great. There's a bit of a learning curve(as there is with most graphing calculators), but the manual helps as well as looking up videos.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: It has all the feature I need for STAT 300. The only problem is figuring out which button to use. It did come with a manual which helped with accessing some of the features, but I wish it would list all the steps instead of explaining what it is use for.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Did not turn on at all worthless. Threw away. Money lost
customer_reviews.author: Georgina Diaz

customer_reviews.title: I find it very easy to use and it has lots of instructions and ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is advertised as primarily a graphing calculator and it completely fulfills this promise. It's very intuitive, there is a learning curve but it's very small. I find it very easy to use and it has lots of instructions and clear icons. It is absolutely invaluable to bc I'm taking calculus but the only problem is that it lacks I/O feature. Anyone looking for a Calc will understand that that's what makes fractions, logs, surds and other math problems easier. It's unfortunate and I would recommend looking into the 9800 series for that. But it is still a great calculator.
customer_reviews.author: marvin macharia

product_meta.title: Casio fx-9750GII Graphing Calculator, Icon Based Menu, color pink
product_meta.description: Color:PinkThe Casio fx-9750GII Graphing Calculator supports students and educators from middle school to high school and into college. Its icon-based menu is easy to navigate and the soft-menus make it easy to access functionality for common tasks. The intuitive software design facilitates a student’s grasp of mathematical concepts, by encouraging student engagement with mathematics, rather than the memorization of keys to effectively promote student success. Recommended for students taking Pre-Algebra, Algebra I & II, Geometry, Trigonometry, AP Calculus, AP Statistics, Biology, Physics, and Business & Finance. Powered by 4 AAA batteries (included).
feature_bullets: Graph rectangular, polar and parametric functions and inequalities, graphical analysis, streamlined solving for intercepts, intersections, etc.
Capable of graphing x= relations. Built-in graphing of conic sections. Interactive Equation Solver.
Easily calculate values for given independent/dependent values. Create tables of values from given functions and generate plots and graphs from tables.
Statistics regressions and graphical displays. Complex number calculations. Prior Recall Entry.
Large 21-character x 8-line display and Icon menu provides easy access to advanced functions.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
